content.question: The graph provided shows the demand (<math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>), marginal revenue (<math alttext="M R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>MR</mi></math>), marginal cost (<math alttext="M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>MC</mi></math>), and average total cost (<math alttext="A T C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ATC</mi></math>) curves for a monopolist. If a regulatory agency requires that the monopolist set a price that earns the monopolist a normal profit, what price will the monopolist set?

unit.text: 6: Market Failure and the Role of Government

topic.text: 6.4: The Effects of Government Intervention in Different Market Structures

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
